alert.note: Alert for Northern Monterey Bay; Santa Cruz Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 24 at 1:39AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Santa Cruz and southwestern Santa Clara Counties through 215 AM PST... At 139 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Santa Cruz, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Santa Cruz, Scotts Valley, Live Oak, Felton, Twin Lakes, Ben Lomond and Lexington Hills. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Northern Monterey Bay; Santa Cruz Mountains
